TopicTitle: Adjacent control flaps flapping in opposite directions from each other?

Articles.Content:
Pictures probably say it all. I have been struggling with this problem for hours now and can not make it go away. No matter where I place the flaps on the wing (above, below) and no matter how I rotate the flap when placing it, I can not get that last flap to rotate in the same direction with the rest of them. The center of mass is fore of all flaps.

What am I missing? Thanks!

UPDATE: jdsutton's post below is the answer!

Edited September 12, 2013 by yevoc
It's not facing exactly straight forward, that could throw the calculations off a bit. I've found that placing flaps at an angle like that can cause some strange control issues as well.

Thats odd. I don't think you've done anything wrong, that looks like a bug. It thinks that bit of wing is on the other side of the plane.

Did you try deleting the wing section and rebuilding it?

Did you try deleting the wing section and rebuilding it?

Yes, and unfortunately it yields the same results. I'll keep tinkering and post this as a bug I suppose? It's definitely proven resilient to my efforts.

It's not facing exactly straight forward, that could throw the calculations off a bit.

jdsutton is right. When I rotated (yaw) the flaps to face more forward, the outer-most flaps started working properly again.

Thanks!
